channel.title: 718 Run (ASAP)
channel.description:
I get this when i run a source, This is my vesion of java "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe"
Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine. Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: 718 Run (ASAP)
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:10, topic:544539”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=663419.msg4434013#msg4434013 date=1404399768]

You need to buy more ram for ur pc

This. Or change your Java arguments (-Xmx and -Xms to use the right amount) post your run.bat

How does that matter? My server used 1gb + memory because I was loading map data into my ram (with very good reason). Setting memory should be what’s recommended. So if his pc doesn’t have enough ram then he’s still screwed.

If you set -Xmx256 then a lot of applications won’t run. If you have 1gb RAM and you set it to -Xmx1G then it’ll most likely run, depends. I only know this from troubleshooting with Minecraft.

@OP re-download Java/JDK.

Or you could just let the system handle the memory and not bother allocating it yourself. Just because he has it set to 1GB doesn’t mean it’ll use 1GB.

But if he has it set to 256, then it’ll cap at 256, when more may be required.

Why would letting the system manage memory cap him to 256 mb?
[/quote]

Oh my fahk, trying to explain something to you is as hard as trying to explain bacon to a pig.[/quote]

The web guy is saying if he has a set amount of memory his server can use it’s obviously not enough so he should raise it higher.

Read full topic

item.title: 718 Run (ASAP)
item.dc:creator: @FrameIt FrameIt
item.description:
@FrameIt wrote:

Run Code

@echo off echo [Nexus] Server is loading.. "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -Xms512m -Xmx512m -cp bin;/data/libs/netty-3.2.7.Final.jar;/data/libs/FileStore.jar Launcher false false true false pause

Error

[Nexus] Server is loading.. Error: missing `server' JVM at `C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\server\jvm. dll'. Please install or use the JRE or JDK that contains these missing components. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
